data.title: Common Good
data.meta_description: Glasgow Caledonian University (GCU) is the University for the Common Good. Our ambitious Vision is that, by 2030, Glasgow Caledonian University will be recognised as a world-leading University for social innovation.
data.text:
Glasgow Caledonian University (GCU) is the University for the Common Good. Our Mission draws on our rich history and founding purpose For the Common Weal as incorporated in our Coat of Arms. Our ambitious Vision is that, by 2030, Glasgow Caledonian University will be recognised as a world-leading university for social innovation.

Caledonian Club

The Caledonian Club is Glasgow Caledonian Universityâ€™s multi-award winning widening participation and community engagement initiative, working across our local communities in Glasgow, London and New York.

Learn more arrow_forward

Common Good Award

The Common Good Award is a skills and personal development award which aims to encourage, support and reward students who are engaged in co and extra-curricular activity aligned to the Common Good.

Learn more arrow_forward

Common Good First

A global network to connect community projects to each other - and to universities around the world

Learn more arrow_forward

Common Good Curriculum

You can find Information on The Common Good Attributes and what we mean by each one.

Learn more arrow_forward

Community and public engagement

The community and public engagement team are your first point of contact with the University. We are here to provide you with access to research and teaching initiatives that can benefit your community.

Learn more arrow_forward

GCU economic impact

Find out about the difference we make in the local and global community.

Learn more arrow_forward

Equality and diversity

Information on GCU's inclusive and supportive learning and working environment.

Learn more arrow_forward

Erase the Grey

The Erase the Grey campaign - launched by GCU - has key messages which challenge stereotypical attitudes and behaviours and reiterates a zero-tolerance policy towards gender-based violence.

Learn more arrow_forward

GCU Foundation

Discover more about supporting GCU students and our vital projects through the work of our Foundation.

Learn more arrow_forward

Social innovation

Social innovation involves new strategies, ideas and organisations that meet social needs of all kinds. It flourishes when people from different backgrounds and experiences come together to produce new ideas and initiatives.

Learn more arrow_forward

Sustainable Development Goals

A collection of 17 global goals were introduced by the United Nations as a set of targets through which the world can tackle the biggest economic, social and environmental challenges we currently face.

Learn more arrow_forward

Sustainability

The University operates a well-established environmental management system, certified ISO14001 /EcoCampus Platinum that provides a robust, externally-verified framework for delivering these commitments.

Learn more arrow_forward
